verses.roman:
tri-jagate yata āche dhana-ratnamaṇi
eka-phalera mūlya kari' tāhā nāhi gaṇi

synonyms: tri-jagate—in the three worlds; yata—as much as; āche—there is; dhana-ratna-maṇi—wealth and riches; eka-phalera—one fruit's; mūlya—price; kari'-calculated; tāhā—that; nāhi—do not; gaṇi—count.
translation: All the wealth in the three worlds cannot equal the value of one such nectarean fruit of devotional service.
